headline: Classic Bisquick Peach Cobbler
description: This Bisquick peach cobbler recipe makes an easy and delicious old-fashioned dessert of canned juicy peaches baked with a simple baking mix batter.
name: Classic Bisquick Peach Cobbler

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Stir together Bisquick mix, milk, and nutmeg in an ungreased 8x8-inch baking dish. Stir in melted butter or margarine until blended.
Stir together peaches and sugar in a bowl until combined; spoon over batter.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden, 50 to 60 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Very easy! Made a few adjustments. Used 1/2 the amount of sugar (brown instead of white). Used frozen peaches and cooked on stovetop first. To the peaches I added: brown sugar, nutmeg, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1 tbl cornstarch. Served with a scoop of ice cream. Yum!

I made lots of changes out of the gate just from reading the original recipe and the first couple of reviews. I knew I would need to doctor up this recipe for it to be a hit for me. First recommendation is to cook the üçë peaches. I used two cans instead of 1, plus one can of water. Add the sugar, the water, nutmeg, and butter to a medium sauce pan. I cut the sugar by about 1/4 cup. Cook the peaches for about 20 minutes or until the peaches become tender.
Loved it! Added more biquick and sugar on top. About 50 min. Bake time.
made in my cast iron skillet. Melted my butter in skillet and then added bisquick and milk batter. Very good.
Incredible and easy !!!

Really good! But I also made a couple changes ... a few tablespoons more of the Bisquick mix because batter seemed a bit watery, only used 1/2 cup sugar (1 cup seemed like A LOT), and added some leftover blueberries because ... why not?
I doubled the recipe and only changed the nutmeg with half cinnamon. I also used fresh peaches instead of canned I baked 53 minutes and really enjoyed the finished product.
I love this recipe. It tasted great. I needed to drain more juice from canned peaches. Was a huge hit overall.

I love to make old Bisquick recipes because they remind me of my mom. Since the peaches I used were from Aldi and packed in flavored syrup after putting them in the batter I just sprinkled with sugar and I used Heart Smart Bisquick.
It‚Äôs the best all my family love it. I put sugar in the batter and peaches. Then, I put Cinnamon instead of nutmeg.
Great

Yum! This is a delicious and easy recipe. I don't change a thing. I like to serve this while still slightly warm with vanilla bean ice cream. It's a big hit at my house and my go-to recipe when I need to make a quick dessert.
No changes this time but next time, I'll add more of the nutmeg. There were no leftovers.
I love the way this turned out. Quick and easy to make. I have just started making it for the second time.

I made this tonite and it was delicious! I did make a couple of exchanges of ingredients. I was out of milk but had an opened can of coconut milk which had about 6 1/2 oz. left in it. I put that into a measuring cup and added enough 7-up to make a full cup. I did not put in the nutmeg. Many years ago when I was young and had my first blender I made a peach milkshake and it was disappointingly bland. Later I read that a bit of almond extract was required to make the flavor pop. I did that the next time and it was terrific. So instead of nutmeg I put a teaspoon of almond extract in the peach and sugar mixture. If I had been using canned peaches I would have probably cut the sugar in half but I was using frozen so decided to use the whole cup. I used a 9 x 9 Corning Ware dish which was a perfect fit. I would be proud to serve this at any function. Thanks for posting such an 
EZ and delicious recipe!
There‚Äôs something wrong with this recipe. 1 cup bus quick plus 1 cup milk yields a batter that is runnier than pancake batter. I used half the amount of milk. Turned out great.

I halved the recipe and accidentally mixed the sugar in with the rest of the batter instead of the with the peaches, so it baked a little differently than intended. The edges caramelized and the center stayed fairly doughy, but I have to say, it was still absolutely scrumptious and my kids and I licked the pan clean!
AMAZING!
This is the easiest and most delicious peach cobbler I‚Äôve ever made!! Doubling the recipe is highly recommended as there will be a demand for seconds!!
I make peach cobbler with this recipe often but decided to try something different so I used frozen blueberries this time. It came out fabulous.
Made this and everyone enjoyed it. Will definitely make it again.

I started with this recipe and made the following changes:
I added 1/2 cup of sugar to the bisquick batter and used 1 1/2 cups of bisquick 

I added 1 tsp of vanilla and used cinnamon instead of nutmeg 

I put the batter in a pie pan then I made a mixture of 8oz cream cheese, 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice and 2T blackberry juice, 1/4 cup of bisquick and 2 eggs. I poured this mixture on top of the batter in the pie pan and baked at 375 for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and top with:
About 3 cups fresh, peeled and sliced yellow peaches, 1/2t cinnamon 1/2 cup brown sugar and a handful of huckleberries.
Return to oven for 20 minutes. Remove and cool. The bisquick crust is like shortbread and combined with the cheesecake filling it is amazing!

I make this the other day. I halved the recipe and made it in my Mom‚Äôs old 8‚Äù cast iron skillet. I kept an eye on it and took it out of the oven at 40 minutes. It came out perfectly. I topped each serving with a scoop of vanilla Tillamook ice cream and some whipped cream.
Delicious! Added 1/2 cup of oats and only 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg. Also added 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon and a dash of vanilla.

So good. Subbed nutmeg for a little less than a 1/2 teaspoon of Trader Joe's pumpkin pie spice which is nutmeg, cinnamon, cardamon and lemon. Only used 1/2 cup sugar as I'd just picked the peaches from my tree and they were perfect.
easy and good
Easy and delicious!!

I love this recipe! I've made this several times, but found that the batter cooks better with fresh peaches (cut into small chunks) rather than canned peaches. Skin can be left on or removed after blanching (your choice!).

In addition to white sugar, I added brown sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice to the peaches abs let them simmer for about 20-30 minutes before adding to the bisquick/ butter mixture. Also, because I'm a fan of crust, I added an extra 1/2 cup each of bisquick mix and milk. 
*My oven is brand new and super hot. I only baked for 40m instead of 50-60m
Instead of peaches I used apples and it came out wonderful
Used fresh peaches. Cut back on the nutmeg and added a bit of cinnamon and vanilla. Was quick, required minimal effort, and tasted great!
It was perfect just the way it was!
Used vanilla instead of nutmeg. Yes, will make again.

I've actually been making this recipe for several years. I don't think I have ever rated it or reviewed it. I have always made it as instructed. I am widowed now so I make it in smaller batches, because I would eat it all by myself. I love peach cobbler and this recipe is so simple even an old guy like me can make it. I tried blueberries they work great too. I did add cinnamon to them-1/2 cinnamon and 1/2 nutmeg. Hmmm, I wonder about apples??? Have to try that next.
tasteless, used frozen peaches and very dry.
I had a 13 by 9 pan so I decided to double the amount came out perfect
I made it. Super easy. Just added 1/2 tsp nutmeg and. 1/2 tsp cinnamon. 2 tsp vanilla extract to peaches.
This was perfect and extremely simple and easy to follow. My very first time making a peach cobbler and my kids loved it. Now they are constantly asking for it. If I could give it more stars, I would
I also added vanilla and cinnamon to the recipe as well as a few blueberries. It was delicious
Added a lil more sugar and cinnamon in peaches and biscuit mix
Loved it! Totally reminded me of my childhood. Mom used to make this when I was a kid and I nailed the memory!
I make this all the time. We love it. I have also used pears instead of peaches. My family prefers cinnamon over nutmeg and homemade whipped cream on top of the warm cobbler yum! yum!

No I made it as the recipe call for ! 
Yes I will make this again
I ran short on bisquick mix so added some flour. It was very good.
I doubled recipe and added lemon juice 2 tbls. Also added brown sugar to wet ingredients And whipped cream for topping
Followed the recipe but used fresh peaches. Supper easy and yummy.
I used cinnamon instead of nutmeg also added honey and added a cup of honey almond granola mix
Followed recipe as written, only halved the recipe. Husband loved it and stated not to lose this recipe.
Gluten free Bisquick, absolutely delicious, my son and I make this often
Quick, easy and delicious! I cut the sugar to 2/3 because of dietary need and used fresh peeled peaches. Perfect...served two nice portions twice. Love this one!

My husband really liked this. It was easy to make. I used 4 cups of sliced fresh peaches and should have used more since they were sliced thin. I used 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/8 teaspoon of nutmeg. I used 1/2 cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar. I also only used 7 ounces of milk in hopes of getting a crunchy crust but that didn't work.

i had to use cinnamon not nutmeg and it was my first time making a cobbler. i sure hope my husband likes it. i dont think i did the batter right. it turned out dark. i did put a teaspoon of vanilla in it and some sugar and cinnamon in the batter. i hope it tastes good! im waiting to show my husband.
So easy! I used six fresh peaches and changed 1/2 tsp nutmeg to 1/4 tsp nutmeg and 1/4 tsp cinnamon. Came out great.
I added just a touch of cinnamon to my sugar mix. Husband thinks I‚Äôm the best wife ever!!!!

I followed this recipe exactly except I used ground cinnamon in place of nutmeg. I also used a round pan. It was very simple to make and tasted delicious! I would prefer more peaches next time, but that can be adjusted. Overall, very good. Will make again!
I cut sugar to a generous 1/4 cup of sugar and about 2&1/2 cups sliced fresh peaches. Very good!
Delicious and easy to make. Delicious with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top.
Quick and easy. Try using the juice for the liquid and cutting back on the sugar

I read the reviews... adding cinnamon and vanilla extract were good suggestions...I used fresh, ripe peaches in place of canned. I yet I can not give higher rating because I disliked the spongy - soggy 'crust'. It was edible, the peaches yummy.
I used 2 large fresh peaches, cinnamon instead of nutmeg, and 1/2 cup butter. YUMMY!!

I was really looking forward to a good peach cobbler. I didn't get one!
If I try this again, I'll sure make some changes! It was WAY too sweet. I like sweet, but this was way overboard. The cake part of it wasn't good either.
Warmed the peaches in a pot with its canned heavy syrup. Did not add sugar but did add cinnamon and nutmeg before spooning over the Bisquick batter
Used it for black berry instead of peach, so didn't add any nutmeg and added a splash of milk to more effectively mix the sugar and berries. Very easy to make and came out great

I used cinnamon nutmeg ground clove and Ginger.
I actually wanted peach cobbler and peach crisp so I combined the 2.. I layered My Pan with my peaches then I poured over my Bisquick mix and on top of my mix I put my crumble.. I'm giving it a five because I tweaked it and it was the bomb diggity..

I was skeptical...nutmeg? Drained canned peaches? Bisquick? But I was tired of chocolate and needed something for my card ladies, so I made a double recipe the same day as cards. It had just cooled for a few hours....suspense as a brave friend served herself a piece and topped it with whipped cream. She was delighted! Even the nutmeg cautious enjoyed a piece! Glad I made it! Served fresh was great, but after a day, liquid from peaches made for soggy cake-so only 4stars. Advise eating same day!
Will definitely make it again. But next time I will Use double up on the ingredients in a larger pan. 8√ó8√ó2 doesn't last long at all.

I made a trial cobbler to see if I want to make it again for our daughter's birthday dinner on Sunday. We all tried it and loved it. I used frozen peaches instead of canned, added cinnamon, and decreased the sugar by maybe 1/8 cup. When I make it again, I will add even more cinnamon.
Quick and easy peasey to make!
Very easy recipe. Tastes great too!
Quick and easy to put togethe. I used pears and made homemade vanilla ice ream to top it.

If you don't like nutmeg, cut it by half and use that half as cinnamon. Put a couple drops of vanilla in and use 1 cup of cane sugar. Cane sugar is sweet, but not as sweet as regular white sugar. Make sure you drain the peaches thoroughly or it will turn out soggy.

I also put organic vanilla in with the peaches. I made this for Thanksgiving and It was very good. I doubled everything in the recipe to have plenty. Turned out perfect. The key to baking it is to first put it on the bottom rack towards the burners for about 30 minutes. Then put it on the top rack for about 20-25 minutes until it's a golden brown color or light brown.

This was really great. I did cook the peaches with sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Once they were at a nice boil, I drained the syrup mixture and just used the peaches. Added nutmeg, cinnamon, and vanilla to the Bisquick and milk. Served it with vanilla bean ice cream. Huge hit. Lots of great flavour. Will make again! Thank you!
followed the exact recipe....very pleased will make again and again and again.......my family loves it been making it for years!!!!

For Becky I baked mine in large cast iron skillet had to double batch. Used 1/4 the sugar used can and fresh peaches I used 1 teaspoon nutmeg and cinnamon I added two tablespoons of corn starch to peaches and a half teaspoon salt . Teaspoon vanilla, I split half the cinnamon and nutmeg between crust batter and peaches ! Baked 60 min at 375 ‚Ä¢ was awesome
Was deliciously delightfully tasting and looking. Will make this my regular summer and winter dessert. I used can peaches in fruit juice. Excellent result.
I did not have any nutmeg so I used cinnamon instead. I did, however, use three large fresh peaches. Very easy and delicious!
Love this simple recipe I also added some vanilla to the batter and cinnamon and to the peaches I added a shot of peach schnapps gave it great flavor
Easy quick yummy!!! I added blueberries, and the family loved it!!
Perfect!! Just like Mom and Grandma made!! Less sugar on fruit plus added cinnamon sugar along with nutmeg to baking mix. Easiest cobbler ever!!
Awesome! Also used cinnamon instead of nutmeg.
Excellent!!!!

Made as directed, it seemed too light on the peaches. I used 3- 15 oz cans of peaches (45 oz as opposed to 29) and the same amount of Bisquik. Instead of putting nutmeg in the Bisquik, I added it to the peaches. It worked out just fine.

When I saw this recipe, I didn't think it would work because of the high liquid to solids ratio; but I went ahead, using mostly cinnamon with a dash of nutmeg and melting butter for the oil component. It took an hour to bake and is delicious. I used an abundance of fresh peaches, didn't measure; just sliced away. This recipe is husband-approved.
did not like!! too wet!!

I thought the equal parts milk and bisquick might make this a bit runny, so I cut the milk to just over 1/2c. Also reduced the sugar to 1/2 c and used fresh, ripe peaches. Still not the caky, flaky cobbler I'd prefer.

Oh. Oh. Oh. This was my first time making bread. I read every review, took all tweets into consideration. I still had questions....did I knead enough!? Do I preheat the oven? Can I bake all 3 loaves at once? I don't have a kitchen aid, am I in over my head? Some folk pi
No, no! What a waste of peaches in this.

This was absolutely amazing! I used fresh, ripe peaches so was able to cut the sugar by more than half. I also added some vanilla (3/4 tsp) and cinnamon instead of nutmeg. I also tossed a small amount of light brown sugar in with the peaches. This is one of the tastiest cobblers I've ever had!

I used about 6 fresh, very ripe peaches. I used half nutmeg, half cinnamon and added a splash of vanilla extract. This is delicious! I just tried some with a dollop of whipped cream on top and yes, it's good! And it's simple to make...
My husband loved this peach cobbler! I added some vanilla, that was the only enhancement.
Needs more flavor than just the nutmeg in the crust.

I make this for a client that is diabetic, so I make a couple minor changes and it is still delicious!
I used 1/2 cup brown splenda with the drained canned lite syrup peaches. This is the first time I added sweetener. Did not have nutmeg, so none used. Served with reddi-whip. Always a big hit!

There is nothing better than warm peach cobbler with ice cream. This is such a simple recipe and I love simple. I did use brown sugar (1/2 c) because I didn't have enough regular sugar on hand. I cant compare it to using white sugar, but it turned out great.
I found this an awesome and extremely easy recipe. I did add a dash of cinnamon to the peaches and sugar. It complimented the nutmeg mixed with the Bisquick. Getting ready to make this again.

Used fresh peaches. Added 1tsp of "Fresh Fruit"to keep from browning. Cut sugar to 1/4 cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Guests loved it! I also liked that there were no dishes to clean up afterwards.

I doubled the recipe and used 8 cups fresh peaches. Although, I reduced the sugar to 1 1/2 cups it was still extremely sweet and the nutmeg a little too strong. Will make it again and cut the sugar and butter in half and reduce the nutmeg. Overall, very easy to make and definitely worth trying again. (55 minutes was perfect.)
Very good and easy. I used half the sugar with fresh peaches. Next time I will use slightly less milk and slightly less butter to make it less soggy.
Made it with fresh peach preserves. It was quick and fast and easy. Served with vanilla ice cream. Yummy
My family love peach cobbler I did add a little brown sugar and white sugar plus vanilla extract with cinnamon to the batter. It was perfect
